WGI_Physical_Science:
IPCC AR6 WGI Report Summary:
- Warming is unequivocal and human-induced.
- Global surface temperature increased by 1.09°C (2011-2020 vs 1850-1900).
- SSP scenarios predict 1.4°C to 4.4°C warming by 2100.
- Sea level rise is irreversible for centuries.
WGII_Impacts_Adaptation:
IPCC AR6 WGII Report Summary:
- 3-14% of terrestrial species at very high extinction risk at 1.5°C.
- Coral reefs: 70-90% loss at 1.5°C, >99% at 2°C.
- 1 billion people in coastal areas at flood risk by 2050.
- Climate Resilient Development (CRD) is the integrated path forward.
WGIII_Mitigation:
IPCC AR6 WGIII Report Summary:
- Emissions must peak before 2025 for 1.5°C.
- 43% reduction by 2030, Net Zero CO2 by early 2050s.
- Solar and wind costs dropped 85% and 55% respectively (2010-2019).
- Mitigation costs are economically feasible (half < $20/tCO2e).
